handling_precautions: Like all mushrooms, do not eat raw
Agaritine may cause allergic reactions in sensitive individuals

primary_toxins.name: Agaritine
primary_toxins.mechanism: Potentially carcinogenic with long-term exposure to high doses, degraded by cooking
primary_toxins.lethal_dose: Not relevant with normal culinary use

symptoms_by_severity.description: No symptoms with proper preparation and consumption
Rare: mild allergic reactions in sensitive individuals

fatality_note: No deaths known. Considered a safe edible and medicinal mushroom.
risk_groups: Immunosuppressed individuals (consult physician before use due to immunostimulating effect)
long_term_effects: No negative long-term effects known with normal use. Traditionally used as a health mushroom.
collection_warnings: Watch for confusion with Inky Mushroom (Agaricus moelleri)
Smell test: almond instead of carbolic smell
storage_risks: Process fresh mushrooms quickly or dry them
contraindications: Consult physician before use as supplement with autoimmune diseases

clinical_case_reports.title: Agaritine content of Agaricus blazei from Brazil
